p: S. pneumoniae is a Gram-positive coccus that can survive under both aerobic and anaerobic conditions [ 59]. It causes mucosal and invasive infections in children and adults, most commonly acute otitis media (AOM), community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), and invasive pneumococcal diseases (IPD), such as bacteraemia and meningitis [ 60, 61, 62, 63, 64].
